lead_paragraph: It is the first time the United States has not voted against the annual resolution condemning the half-century-old embargo.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and RICK GLADSTONE

headline.print_headline: U.S. Abstains in U.N. Vote on Embargo Against Cuba
headline.main: U.S. Abstains in U.N. Vote Condemning Cuba Embargo

snippet: It is the first time the United States has not voted against the annual resolution condemning the half-century-old embargo....
abstract: United States abstains from United Nations General Assembly condemnation of 50-year-old US trade embargo against Cuba; is first time US delegation has not voted against resolution, which has been offered every year since 1991; abstention is latest signal from Obama administration about its intent to repair relations with Cuba.
